Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Andres M
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Sevilla Palace, it's centrally located on Reforma. Excellent rates and very comfortable. The very best of hotels in Mexico City!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: XFisher
Reviews.Content: Located at Reforma, a busy street close to business and political centers of Mexico. It is an old hotel and desperately needs an uplift. Furniture and carpets need to be replaced. Rooms are fair sized and confortable. As in most old hotels in Mexico City, the air conditioning system does not work very good, and this hotel is no exeption. The food at the hotel cafeteria is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Staff unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Paapamon
Reviews.Content: I stay from 7-10 sept . They reception staff were rude and unfiendly. Rooms Look old. No LCD tv no good tv cable. The looby bar has live music that you can hear in the room(I was on floor 15 and I cAn hear it. Water pipe from wc has water flood. Room was no good illumination, shower is dark & all day & night you hear flush water from the pipe from others floor rooms . Didn't come back again

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ,location and budget rate”
Reviews.Author: PANCHOBARRONR
Reviews.Content: i stay in the Sevilla Palace,because i got a good rate 1000 pesos or 80 dlls for a double room,its located in reforma street and next to the the new senate bulding a copy of the united nations building,,,you have near by starbuccks,and a oxxo convienece store waking distance,,,the breakfast bufffet is very good and complete,,,this a bussness class hotel it is not new but comfortable,frendly staff and great location i will come back

Reviews.Title: “This was so bad, I decided to write a review while I am still here...”
Reviews.Author: OlyaDallas
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start by saying that objectively speaking, it is not a total disaster and I have stayed at worse places before. This is definitely the worst place I ever stayed at that rates itself as a 5 star hotel. This was built in the 70s, and is well kept for an old property (fairly clean), but it is old, and not in a charming way. 1. The matress feels like a marble countertop. My bed at home is pretty hard too, so for me it was manageable, but still a bit too hard. 2 people traveling with me said they could not sleep at all. Pillows seem to be made of stones too. 2. The toilet is leaking - on the above the sewage part, but still. 3. The lobby bar turns on elevator music style piano player, and you can hear it in the room for the whole 2 hrs of the concert every evening. 3 nights in a row so far, extended coverage on Friday. 4. The gym of this 18 story hotel has a total of 3 treadmills and one elliptical. The elliptical was broken. The treadmill I ended up on was very old fashioned, with a solid metal frame. As I was walking on it for some 15 min, a gym attendant came up to me and asked nicely if i was getting any electic shocks from it. She offered me 2 towels to put on the handrails for insulation. I am not kidding. 5. The lobby bar looks like it was built in 1972 and has the appropriate period music on. 6. Most of TV channels got interference so you can't really watch them. No English speaking channels (I speak Spanish so I don't care, but I can see how it could be a turn-off). 7. The mini-bar in the room is locked with a key and you have to call downstairs to get it open. Would not be as bad if they did not keep the coffee packs in there too. 8. Speaking about coffee, breakfast coffee is more like coffee flavored water. 9. Speaking about coffee flavored water, I ordered room service tonight and asked for hot tea - a large pot. I got a large pot of hot coffee flavored water (same breakfast coffee pot..). In case you are not a tea drinker and don't know how bad this tastes, imagine that your coffee was brewed with tea instead of water. Same stuff. The problem did eventually get resolved, but it took 75 min and 2 coffee pots. I am writing this about 2 hrs after I ordered my tea, and about 45 min after I finally received it, so I am still irritated, but hopefully staying objective... Is this place terrible? No. No major health threats (though don't use the 'ice machine' - I saw the bucket they pour the ice from...). No real safety issues. The employees are friendly. Would I stay here again? Absolutely not, and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: chuck1063
Reviews.Content: My local office booked me at this hotel when I traveled to Mexico City last week. The hotel itself was quite nice with lots of amenities, but the beds were unbelievable. The beds were bolted to the floor and were so hard that i tried to sleep in the chair! That did not work so i took the comforter and the extra blanked and folded them up several times to make a cushy pad to sleep on! Next time I'm staying next door at the Embassy Suites even if it costs more!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless - reliably consistent quality service”
Reviews.Author: VikingDNA58
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel with friendly, competent staff. Most guests at the Sevilla Palace are business people and the staff are attentive to their demanding needs. This is a plus for us pleasure travelers for we get the same quality service. I especially enjoy the location of the hotel near the Columbus Circle intersection and request rooms with a view of Paseo de La Reforma Ave. Easy access to all areas that I want to visit and the hotel offers free indoor parking for guests. Have stayed at the Sevilla Palace numerous times and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor connection”
Reviews.Author: lavigheni
Reviews.Content: Four days stop in mexico city before going back to Europe. The hotel is well mantained and everyone is very kind and helpful. Te hotel offers a beautiful swimming pool on the top roof garden, with a beautiful view of the city. On the contrary rooms are too small and there is a big television that takes almosta half of the disposable space. This hotel has very convenient special weekend fares but, we were very surprised, if you want to use the internet you have to buy 6 or 12 hour packages and you can't disconnect! So if you read your emails before going to sleep the morning after you have to buy another packege. It's incredible in one month spent in Mexico this is never happened. The worst thing is that at "centro de negocios", were you buy the package noone tells you anythingabout that. Another thing that we didn't like is that the hotel ask credit card authorzation of about the double you are suppose to spend in the hotel. Also in this case no one tells anything in advance.

Reviews.Title: “great guest service”
Reviews.Author: greenraveler
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 7 days stay in these Hotel, all staff was very helpfull , polite and ready to help , any time .Rooms clean, daily service. Great location, 30 min walking distance to Museum , downtown, shoping, metro . Good breakfast in hotel restaurant , we did use hotel restaurant for dinner 2 x. Starbuck cross the streat for good coffe. Well vorth take hotel "taxi" to pyramid - all day $150.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrsbrowniz38
Reviews.Content: My husband and i went on a familly vacation with my aunt, cousins and grandmother and we ALL loved it! Everyone was VERY nice and polite, had no problems with anything. My cousins are thinking about coming back this Dec08 since my aunt past away in 05 and we are probably going back with them for the memories :), This hotel is the BEST, great location and very SAFE :) S&K from Fort Smith, Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice”
Reviews.Author: Ender604
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel twice in less than a month. I stayed for 4 nights each time but on my next trip I'll probably change. I have nothing against this hotel, I just want to try something else so I can compare properly. I'll probably edit this post once i return to Mexico but the for the time beeing let me quickly describe my experience. The rooms are very large and if you get a high exterior room you'll have a great view over the city (ask for the back side of the hotel, more quiet and better view). The bed was very big and comfortable and I had everything I needed: big desk, arm chair etc... The bathrom did seem a little old but it was functional enough. I dinned at the Naranjo's several times and it was worth it. Most of the employees were very pleasent (specially the maids) but the front desk people not so much. One thing that made my stay very positive was the all around wifi connection. I travel with my laptop all the time and it was great to use the internet even during breakfast. As I said, it is a nice hotel, but before I give my final opinion I'd like to compare it with another 5 star hotel in Mexico D.F.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_feedback_10
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, wonderful amenities. Here is my review: Positives: - Pool in the pent house, very nice view of the city from the top of the hotel - Travel agency in the hotel were very friendly, they have a lot of different tours to choose from - Lounge area by the restaurant where you have a piano player, a nice place to relax - Rooms are extra clean, the furniture looks very attractive and nicely chosen - Bell boys service was good. - Staff and waiters at the restaurant were very friendly and provided very nice service. - Location, it was safe for me to walk in the streets around the hotel even during the night Negatives: 1. Noise, if you are in a room in the center of the hotel atrium, expect to hear the piano playing until 11:00 PM while in your room. Worse, if there is a party going on in one of their dancing halls, it may continue to 3:00 AM in the morning. Therefore, make sure to ask for a room as far away from the noise as possible if you want to get some sleep. 2. Internet charges: They charge you by time intervals, 12 hours (92 pesos )or 24 hours (138 pesos). I thought this was inconvenient for a long stay, it would be nice if they charge one flat rate for the stay or provide the internet for free like other hotels in Mexico city. Sometimes you can negotiate to get 24 hours for the price of 12 Other tips: - The Taxis standing by the hotel are super expensive. You can stop a green beetle taxi or a white and red taxi for your ride instead and save up to 80% of the price. However, be careful and make sure the meter in the taxis are working. - There is a nice taco restaurant I liked very much by the hotel, it is called El-Caminero. It was not very expensive (around 80 pesos for dinner including a drink). The food tasted extremely delicious!! When you exit the hotel main door, make a left then walk until you reach the first side street, make a left again and walk around 300 M, the Restaurant will be on your left.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: Nonprofit business traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice while on business in the spring of 2005. I found the hotel to be a good value for the money, at least in Mexico City terms. It has pretty good amenities--a pool, small gym, and business center which are rare in hotels in this price category. I was pleasantly surprised by the cheaper of its two restaurants Naranjos. The food was quite good--a nice blend of traditional Mexican and international. A good value for the price. I ate at the more expensive restaurant one night and paid a lot more for food that wasn't really all that good. The staff are helpful and friendly, and the rooms are very clean as someone else pointed out. However, the hotel has 4 negative points that ultimately have led me not to return. 1) Internet is only available in the rooms on the courtyard side of the hotel. This side of the building has virtually no natural sunlight reaching the rooms. 2) Rooms on the street side are very noisy. Reforma is a MAJOR avenue with very bad traffic jams. (Of course, you get a bird's eye view of all protests, which can be interesting). 3) Even the rooms on the street side are very dark, and frankly depressing. 4) The entrances to all the rooms are on a central atrium. This is an interesting architectual feature and quite attractive (in a 1960s/70s kind-of way), but it's not such a good arrangement if you are a single woman. You can see what room anyone goes into from pretty much any point in the atrium, including the restaurant. So, I felt a bit vulnerable. Overall, it's a good choice for people on a budget. Like so many hotels in the center it was built during an unfortunate period for architecture and style, so the rooms and furniture are funky colors and a little awkward. But, that's not their fault. They do a good job with what they have.

Reviews.Title: “Its Worth the Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our one-week vacation, my partner and I choose this hotel based on the location, price, and previous trip advisor reviews. The hotel is centrally located in the business district, on the Paseo de la Reforma, and is very accessible by public transportation or cab. The nearest metro station is Hidalgo, which is five blocks away. The Mexican Metro system is comparable to the Washington, DC and New York City systems. For those who are adventurous, the bus stops are across the street from the hotel. You can walk to the Zocalo and Zona Rosa, and itâ€™s about a10 minute cab ride to Condesa and Polanco. In less than one-two blocks, you can get to the post office, convenience store, internet cafÃ©, fast food restaurants, and car rental offices. We had a non-smoking room with double beds (a sitting area included) on the 21st floor for $71.00/night. Please request a city view; itâ€™s a must!! You can enjoy the Mexico City view in the day and night. The room was very, very clean. Every night, the housekeeping staff would refresh the room and turn down the beds. We found most of the hotel staff extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and friendly. The concierge and front-desk staff spoke English. A few more comments that we would add are (1) do not exchange your dollars at the hotel since the exchange rate is lower than other exchange services; (2) although the cab stand is expensive, it is very safe; and (3) be aware that most museums are closed on Mondays so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: williamswanson
Reviews.Content: We bought a package deal for Seville Palace over the Thanksgiving holiday 2004 for a great price. The hotel is in a great location on Reforma, very clean, great service I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel geared towards business travelers. My partner and I (a lesbian couple) stayed there as tourists and we were pleased with how quite and nice the hotel is, and we got a great internet rate of about $75/night. The rooms are large and have a sitting area in addition to the bed and bathroom. Our room was quite dark, even with all the lights on and curtains open. It overlooked a dark courtyard so that didn't help. I'd recommend getting a room looking outside the building if possible. The gym is very well equiped for a hotel, even has a punching bag. And the restaurant (Naranjos) is good and reasonably priced (though much cheaper food can be found elsewhere in the city). If you're looking for tourist information, don't expect too much from the hotel, it doesn't seem to devote much attention to that. And I speak spanish so I can't attest to their english speaking abilitites. The hotel is a nice walk to the Zocalo and the Zona Rosa (it is inbetween the two) right on a main street. A few other tips: don't use the private cabs just outside the hotel door (that the door men will offer you). Their rates are much higher than the green and white ones you can flag down on the streets. We enjoyed the touribus tour of the city (which stops right near the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Sevilla Palace Hotel in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: KS69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year and was very impressed. For the price and quality, it cannot be beat. it's a business hotel so there's not a lot of tourists or a tourist focus (which suits me just fine) but the nice thing about business hotels is that they like to keep everything clean. Which in Mexico is really damn important. The restaurant is OK, the pool is halfway decent, worth a swim if there isnt anyone else around. I'll be staying here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “the price is damn good for this nice, clean, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty nice, really clean, and the staff was pretty damn good. Its right in the commercial district of d.f. and easy to get anywhere. Within walking distance of the metro as well. for the price, it can;t be beat. Its always kinda wierd looking for hotels in Mexico but i'm glad i stayed here, i will stay here again next time i go. the night time act is pretty cheezy but entertaining.the rooms were really good size as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sevilla Palace over the course of four nights. Seems to be a mostly business-oriented hotel, but for tourism purposes was great, too. The glass elevators in the 23 or 24 story hotel were beautiful. Staff is helpful and it isn't hard to find someone who can speak English. (Although they are very encouraging when one tries to speak Spanish.)It's located smack downtown, near the intersection of Reforma and Insurgentes, the two main roads that divide the city N-S and E-W. It's a pleasant walk to the presidential palace and main cathedral. It's also close to the fun zona rosa, with many restaurants and shops.The food is fantastic at this hotel. The breakfast buffet is well worth getting up for and includes both Mexican and American fare. (Cactus juice is a surprise!)There are a couple of bars/lounges, which are comfortable and often have life performers singing in Spanish.The pool/jacuzzi is on the rooftop and, while small, provides a great view of this vast city.The rooms are nice, include TV, marble bathroom. The only complaint is the bed was hard.
